programme.title: Dog Days
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E14, A barking dog means sleepless nights for Doug and Carrie; Arthur thinks that a popular comic strip is based on his life.

programme.title: Crappy Birthday
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E15, Doug forgets Carrie's 30th birthday and has plans to watch the wrestling match; Doug must scramble to put together a romantic evening.

programme.title: S'Ain't Valentine's
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E16, Arthur meets an intoxicating stranger at a singles' dance; Carrie and Doug's romantic evening is spoiled.

programme.title: Court Date
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E17, Doug encourages Carrie to date the police officer who stopped her, hoping to get out of her fourth traffic ticket of the year and avoid a hefty increase in their car insurance.

programme.title: White Collar
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E18, Doug inherits his shift supervisor's job after an untimely death but soon misses his old responsibilities.

programme.title: Rainy Day
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E19, Ray (Ray Romano) invites Doug to play golf at an exclusive country club; Marie (Doris Roberts) teaches Carrie how to clean a house.

programme.title: Train Wreck
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E20, Doug is disappointed when Carrie isn't jealous of his beautiful trainee; Arthur feels he's been scammed when he orders a gravestone.

programme.title: Hungry Man
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E21, Carrie is embarrassed by Doug when he shows up unexpectedly and famished at her boss's elegant "drinks-only" cocktail party.

programme.title: Time Share
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E22, Carrie befriends her annoying neighbors so that their week at a Hamptons time share does not go unused; Arthur develops a nasty rash.

programme.title: Where's Poppa?
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E23, Doug convinces cousin Danny (Gary Valentine) to take Arthur for the weekend; Doug is hit by a baseball and meets a new friend (Bill Cosby) at Dr. Becker's (Ted Danson) office.

programme.title: Art House
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E24, Arthur moves into his own apartment after Doug tells him how he feels about his eccentric behavior; Carrie is concerned that her father can't take care of himself.

programme.title: Maybe Baby
programme.desc: King of Queens, S01E25, A visit with Deacon's three-year-old son prompts Doug and Carrie think about having a baby; Arthur recalls the night Carrie was born.

programme.title: Queasy Rider
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E01, Doug buys a motorcycle against Carrie's wishes, prompting her to take up cigarette smoking to spite him.

programme.title: Female Problems
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E02, Doug encourages Carrie to make new friends but then he feels left out when she starts spending a lot of time with their new neighbor.

programme.title: Assaulted Nuts
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E03, After Doug convinces Carrie he doesn't goof around at work, horseplay gets him into a painful and embarrassing predicament.

programme.title: Parent Trapped
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E04, Deacon and Kelly ask Doug and Carrie to be the godparents of their new baby; Arthur is put in charge of the pretzel shop.

programme.title: Tube Stakes
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E05, Doug gets upset with Carrie after his big-screen TV set is stolen because she accidentally left the garage door open.

programme.title: Doug Out
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E06, Doug feels so guilty about putting down Arthur that he gives him one of his Mets tickets; Doug gets arrested trying to catch a foul ball.

programme.title: Get Away
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E07, Doug and Carrie feel inadequate when they discover that their best friends have a very active love life.

programme.title: Dire Strayts
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E08, Doug and Carrie invite Ray and Debra Barone to dinner; Doug gets stuck in an opening leading up to the attic.

programme.title: I, Candy
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E09, Doug gets an ego boost when an attractive waitress wants to know if he's single.

programme.title: Roamin' Holiday
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E10, Doug invites Spence to move in as part of a plan to keep Carrie's annoying friends from spending a weekend.

programme.title: Sparing Carrie
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E11, Doug's bowling-team sponsor demands victory, meaning Doug may have to fire his team's weak link: his wife, Carrie.

programme.title: Net Prophets
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E12, Carrie insists on using Doug's Christmas bonus to invest in Internet stock.

programme.title: Party Favor
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E13, Carrie helps Doug plan a bachelor party after she volunteers him to be the friendless Danny's best man.

programme.title: Block Buster
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E14, Doug's memories of his glory days as a football player don't match those of his old teammates.

programme.title: Frozen Pop
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E15, Arthur disrupts Carrie and Doug's lives by moving from the cold basement to the much warmer second floor.

programme.title: Fair Game
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E16, Doug is distraught when he learns that Carrie has been cheating at board games.

programme.title: Meet By-Product
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E17, Carrie and Doug reminisce about how they first met, remembering that it certainly wasn't love at first sight.

programme.title: The Shmenkmans
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E18, Doug and Carrie search for new friends, who do not have children; Arthur rediscovers a breakfast cereal from his childhood.

programme.title: Surprise Artie
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E19, Doug tries to keep Arthur busy while Carrie sets up a surprise party for his 75th birthday.

programme.title: Wild Cards
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E20, Doug loses all his money when he goes to Atlantic City with Deacon; Arthur threatens to injure Carrie's boss.

programme.title: Big Dougie
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E21, Big Brother Doug tries anything to impress his new protege, including entering a 10K run.

programme.title: Soft Touch
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E22, Doug is duped by Tim into participating in a pyramid scheme that requires him to sell water filters.

programme.title: Restaurant Row
programme.desc: King of Queens, S02E23, Carrie bars Doug from eating at his favorite Italian restaurant, but he goes back for lunch and bites off more than he can chew.

programme.title: Peterson Principle
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E18, Norm gets a tip at work that could guarantee his promotion over the competition.

programme.title: Dark Imaginings
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E19, Sam suffers a hernia while trying to prove that he's not getting too old.

programme.title: Save The Last Dance For Me
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E20, Carla turns to Sam as a partner to go up against Nick and Loretta in a dance competition.

programme.title: Fear Is My Co-Pilot
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E21, Sam and Diane reveal their true feelings for each other while on the verge of death.

programme.title: Diane Chambers Day
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E22, Frasier plans a pick-me-up party for Diane, but she thinks it was Sam's idea.

programme.title: Relief Bartender
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E23, Woody feels replaceable when an entertaining bartender overshadows him.

programme.title: Strange Bedfellows (Part 1)
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E24, Sam expresses interest in politics when he falls for a woman running for city council.

programme.title: Strange Bedfellows (Part 2)
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E25, Diane quits when she finds out Sam's girlfriend wants her fired.

programme.title: Strange Bedfellows (Part 3)
programme.desc: Cheers, S04E26, Diane tries to make Sam's life miserable for pushing her out the door.

programme.title: The Proposal
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E01, It is revealed that it was Diane to whom Sam proposed on the telephone in the last episode.

programme.title: Cape Cad
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E02, Sam's date, Vicki, checks out of a country inn to visit her grandmother in the hospital.

programme.title: Money Dearest
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E03, Cliff fixes his mother, Esther, up with the wealthy Duncan Fitzgerald.

programme.title: Abnormal Psychology
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E04, Frasier appears on a television show for a debate with Dr. Lilith Stern.

programme.title: House Of Horrors With Formal Dining and Used Brick
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E05, Cliff stays the night when Carla gets spooked in her new house.

programme.title: Tan N' Wash
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E06, Norm is excited about a new business venture, a combination laundromat and tanning salon.

programme.title: Young Doctor Weinstein
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E07, Sam steals Diane's dinner reservations at a fancy restaurant.

programme.title: The Knights Of Scimitar
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E08, Diane tries to make Sam jealous by flirting with one of her students.

programme.title: Thanksgiving Orphans
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E09, The Cheers gang has a Thanksgiving feast at Carla's new house.

programme.title: Everyone Imitates Art
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E10, A magazine rejects Diane's poem and accepts Sam's writing instead.

programme.title: Book Of Samuel
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E11, Woody lies to his hometown girlfriend when she shows up with another guy.

programme.title: Dance, Diane, Dance
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E12, Diane is fooled into believing that she's a dance star waiting to happen.

programme.title: Chambers Vs. Malone
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E13, Diane tricks Sam into proposing to her again and she accepts.

programme.title: Diamond Sam
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E14, Diane throws her engagement ring out the window when she mistakes it for a fake.

programme.title: Spellbound
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E15, Diane and Carla console Loretta, who has caught Nick cheating on her.

programme.title: Never Love A Goalie (Part 1)
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E16, Carla falls head over heals for hockey star Eddie LeBec, a newly acquired goalie for the Bruins.

programme.title: Never Love A Goalie (Part 2)
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E17, Carla realizes she's the reason Eddie's hockey game is suffering.

programme.title: One Last Fling
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E18, Diane and Sam agree to a twenty-four hour separation to purge other desires.

programme.title: Dog Bites Cliff
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E19, Cliff files a lawsuit and ends up getting blindsided by the beautiful defendant.

programme.title: Dinner At Eight-Ish
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E20, The regulars meet over dinner to discuss Frasier asking Lilith to move in.

programme.title: Simon Says
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E21, Diane and Sam are given a bleak prognosis from a noted marriage counselor.

programme.title: The Godfather (Part III)
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E22, Sam flips out when his goddaughter visits and agrees to move in with Woody.

programme.title: Norm's First Hurrah
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E23, Norm lies about the prestige of his new position at a CPA firm.

programme.title: Cheers: The Motion Picture
programme.desc: Cheers, S05E24, Woody's parents want him to move back home, but the regulars try to keep him.
